doc.field: This volume begins with Beatrice and Sidney's courtship. It includes wedding (1931) memorabilia, concert and theatre programs, invitations to formal dances at Rodeph Sholom and elsewhere, menus (among them, one from Rumpelmayer's and one from the Empire State Observation Room Fountain and Tea Room), ticket stubs, Ziegfield Follies programs; and cards, menus, photos from the Berrys' honeymoon trip to San Francisco by train, pamphlets from Hollywood openings, and other incidentals from the trip. Also includes photos of family and New York apartment, 1932 map of Broadway theaters, brochures of Halloween formal, business meetings and social gatherings at Rodeph Sholom, and ephemera from the mayoral campaign of Joseph V. McKee of the Recovery Party (1933).
